column4: Hey all, I was trying to install Windows AFTER installing Linux, but was having problems. Can anyone help out?
unfortunately, i've been using linux for a while and backing up all files, clearing the drive then reinstalling is a real pain :(
not too worried about the mbr, i've already replaced that once. problem is that windows keeps thinking logical partitions are primaries and doesn't want to install otherwise
is there anyway to hide those partitions from windows? or perhaps just format an empty partition to ntfs and then let windows installer go from there
hiding works with some commercial software at least, not sure if parted supports it
what if i format through parted before i go to install anything? can we just "skip" the partitioning step w/ windows?
no, you have to tell windows at least where to install
yeah, that's fine, but it shouldn't complain then should it since it has a ntfs partition to work with?
i just don't get why windows doesn't see the partitions as extended/logical
dreamweaver is epic fail btw ... just saying
says there are too many partitions and then won't format
then maybe all are primary and the parition utility fucked up? or some corruption? any way to check / fix part tables?
i did that once already with a utility called testdisk
back up everything, next time make sure your partition utility works nicer?
what do you want to do with DW?
